title: 110_hr865
content: The Act may be cited as the "Copper Valley Native Allotment Resolution Act of 2007". It includes definitions for clarity. The Act defines "Association" as the Copper Valley Electric Association and "Native allotment" as specific allotments issued under the Act of May 17, 1906. The Act defines "Native allotment" as specific allotments issued under the Act of May 17, 1906, excluding allotments with approved rights of way or patents. The term "Secretary" refers to the Secretary of the Interior, and "State" refers to the State of Alaska. SEC. 3. ELECTRIC TRANSMISSION LINE RIGHTS-OF-WAY. The Association is granted rights-of-way across Native allotments for an electric transmission line. The Secretary determines the legal description and widths of the rights granted. The Act does not apply to land owned by Ahtna, Inc. Compensation for the rights-of-way is appraised by the Secretary. The Secretary grants rights-of-way over Native allotments for an electric transmission line, determines legal descriptions and widths, and appraises compensation. The Act excludes land owned by Ahtna, Inc. Compensation procedures are provided to owners or heirs/assigns, and recordable instruments are issued to indicate rights-of-way locations. Publication in the Federal Register is required. The Secretary grants rights-of-way over Native allotments for an electric transmission line, determines legal descriptions and widths, and appraises compensation. Compensation procedures are published in the Federal Register and newspapers within the service area. The location of the right-of-way is provided to the Secretary for calculation of payments. The Secretary determines compensation for a portion of a Native allotment encumbered by a right-of-way based on an appraisal and calculates interest according to the Uniform Appraisal Standards for Federal Land Acquisitions and section 3116 of title 40, United States Code. The date of valuation for each right-of-way acquisition by the Association is specified. The Association's acquisition of each right-of-way is considered effective as of the enactment of this Act. Judicial review is limited to the Secretary's determination of compensation for a right-of-way over a Native allotment. Authorization of appropriations is granted to carry out this Act. (Passed the House of Representatives April 17, 2007)
